help.title: Help & Shortcuts
help.introduction: Welcome to ThinkDashboard! Here are the main features and shortcuts to help you navigate and use the app efficiently.
help.shortcutsLauncher: Bookmark Shortcuts: Press any letter key on the dashboard to start typing a shortcut. For example, if you have a bookmark with shortcut yt, just type yt and the app will open it automatically.
help.fuzzySearch: Fuzzy Search: Press / to search for bookmarks by name. Start typing and it will find matches as you go.
help.commands: Commands: Type : followed by a command to control the app. Available commands include: theme (switch theme), columns (change columns), fontsize (change font size), and more to come.
help.pageNavigation: Page Navigation: Use number keys 1, 2, 3, etc. to switch between pages on the dashboard.
help.touchNavigation: Touch Navigation: On mobile or touch devices, swipe left or right to change pages.
help.arrowNavigation: Arrow Navigation: Press Shift + Left Arrow or Shift + Right Arrow to navigate between pages.
help.keyboardNavigation: Keyboard Navigation: Use arrow keys to navigate between bookmarks on the dashboard. Press Enter or Space to open the selected bookmark.
help.searchMode: Search Mode: You can switch the search behavior. By default, typing starts shortcuts and / starts fuzzy search. You can toggle this in config#general.
help.dataStorage: Data Storage: All app data is saved in the /data directory. This includes JSON files for settings (your dashboard settings), pages (pages order), and colors (custom themes), as well as uploaded favicon, fonts, and individual bookmark pages (bookmarks-1.json, bookmarks-2.json, etc.).
help.deviceSpecificSettings: Device-Specific Settings: When enabled, your dashboard settings are saved locally in your browser instead of on the server. This means settings are specific to this device/browser and won't sync across different devices.
help.feedback: Found a bug or have feedback? Visit the GitHub repository to report issues or suggest improvements.
help.extensionIntro: ThinkDashboard includes a Chrome extension that allows you to quickly add bookmarks from any webpage directly to your dashboard.
help.extensionInstall: To install the extension: Clone the GitHub repository to your local machine, or download the latest version from here. Then go to Chrome's extension settings (chrome://extensions/), enable "Developer mode", and click "Load unpacked". Select the extension folder from the downloaded or cloned repository.
help.extensionConfig: Configuration: Once installed, open the extension and go to the Settings tab. Enter your ThinkDashboard URL, set the Default Page where bookmarks will be saved, and choose the category within that page.
help.extensionUsage: Usage: Click the extension icon, optionally modify the name, URL, page, and category, then click Save Bookmark.
